definition: Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
plum
surname Li
mound/tomb/hill/mountain

sentences.english: Li Ling shamefully surrendered for the moment, planning to wait for an opportunity to strike back.
sentences.chinese: 李陵打算暫時先忍辱投降，以便伺機等待機會反擊。

definition: Li Guang (-119 BC), Han dynasty general, nicknamed Flying General 飛將軍|飞将军 and much feared by the Xiongnu 匈奴
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Qin general Meng Tian (-210 BC), involved in 215 BC in fighting the Northern Xiongnu 匈奴 and building the great wall
Ban Chao (33-102), noted Han diplomat and military man
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Su Wu (140-60 BC), Han Dynasty diplomat and statesman, regarded as a model of courage and faithful service
Zhou Bo (?-169 BC), military man and politician at the Qin-Han transition, a founding minister of Western Han
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
chanyu (Han Dynasty name for chiefs of Xiongnu Huns 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2])
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
Yuan Emperor, reign name of Han Dynasty emperor Liu Shi 劉奭|刘奭[Liu2 Shi4], (74-33 BC), reigned 48-33 BC
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Xue Rengui (614-683) great Tang dynasty general
Huangfu Song (-195), later Han general and warlord
